channel.title: Images
channel.description: Would it be better to dynamically create thumbnails or should I make a folder with all the thumbnails already in it?

item.title: Images
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Actually, I’m thinking about making a Java application do it. I guess either one would work, but I fancy Java much more ^.^

But yeah, if I’m loading 30+ images per page, I’m pretty sure dynamically making them would be a large load on the server. Just wasn’t sure how that worked, tbh.

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Images
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

eVokki`:

I would PERSONALLY Dynamically create them, mainly for speed issues if the gallery or image folder contains a load of images, in my opinion it’s personal preference but the folder option would take a while.

It would take longer to dynamically create them, and it would put a huge load on the server.

I say, when you upload a picture, upload it through html/php, and have gdlibrary dynamically export a thumbnail to a separate folder. Semi-dynamic, I suppose.

Read full topic
